data.title: New Script Theme, and export(String, MULTILINE) support.
data.body: Changed the scripting IDE Theme to match the Dark theme more. Added supp...ort for export(String, "Multiline") var some_string = ""

data.title: Cannot use relative path to create a scene
data.body:
```
.
├── dir
│   ├── main.gd
│   └── main.xml
└── engine.cfg
```

```
# main.gd
extends Node
func _ready():
    print(load("main.xml"))
    print(load("res://dir/main.xml"))
```

output:
[Object:null]
[PackedScene:505]

data.title: AnimationPlayer crashes
data.body:
Godot crashes, when changing "Step(s)" value in AnimationPlayer before adding any animation in player.
Checked on stable release and build from two days old source, on three different Windows 7 based PCs.

data.title: Crash in shader_graph_editor_plugin.cpp during editor launching.
data.body:
Crashed [here](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/blob/master/tools/editor/plugins/shader_graph_editor_plugin.cpp#L1409)

Because of ShaderGraphEditor::node_names is not updated since more enum values were added into ShaderGraphic::NodeType.

And I suggest to modify this piece of code like [this](https://github.com/quabug/godot/commit/197749f9770fd5494dd8f2f8e7a7e11acb1c26b4), which avoid(warn, at least) further mistake by slightly increase CPU usage during construct a new instance of ShaderGraphEditor. This modification is more a code style changing rather than a bug fixing, so I will not pull this patch to master branch until you guys approve it(or you can modify it by yourself).

data.title: Sprite3D and Quad in one Viewport increases CPU usage
data.body:
When I create empty project and add at scene one of Sprite3D or Quad it works great and CPU usage remains normal (~2-3%):

![good_proc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3995047/5792403/563442d2-9f49-11e4-95a5-b8ded3a27e82.png)

But when I add both of them at scene, CPU usage increases to ~26%:

![bad_proc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3995047/5792411/88e2a82c-9f49-11e4-823b-81019bfdf05a.png)

My platform is Windows.

data.title: Put the completion tooltip under the edited line
data.body:
Hi,

It happens frequently that the previous line of code contains information that I need to write the new line, but I can't see it because the tooltip hides it.

So, it would be cool if the tooltip was displayed UNDER the line being written.

data.title: Can't create framebuffer for vd on old Intel GPU
data.body:
I created a new project in Godot, and when it was opened, the 3D view was looking weird and this error was shown at the bottom of the editor: `drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp:3972 - Can't create framebuffer for vd`

Here is a screenshot:

![godoterror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/5791807/64d8fce2-9eb8-11e4-88a4-41ecd35c2aec.png)

data.title: Modifiers are unset on events for the modifier key itself
GodotPayments documentation
data.body: Can someone write in the wiki how to use this singleton on android? I saw that in the java source but I'can make it work from gdscript.

data.body:

data.title: New theme button hover and click colours hard to distinguish
data.body: In the new theme the colours for button hover and click are very close and so hard to distinguish, giving poor visual feedback on button click.

data.title: Very different light in Editor VS GameView
data.body:
In the next screenshot, you will see that the lights result are really different between the editor view and the game view.

I am using a WorldEnvironment and an Omnilight.

![screen shot 2015-01-18 at 01 48 41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4760796/5791003/cdee5298-9eb5-11e4-9e89-fbd60fc11d08.png)

Is this normal ?

data.title: [2D] ImageTexture (PNG) of 832x3200px appears all black!
data.body:
Everything was working fine before I compiled the commit 2b22aba39e5dc449ab1f50cd497a1a39358ce84a, but in this commit my large PNG file appears all black. This don't happen with tiny PNG images.

![godot1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/5790878/4028d780-9e74-11e4-884f-9784a51123eb.png)

This may be relevant: I'm using a modified IBM thinkpad T60 laptop.

data.title: Import sub-scene/merge nodes from scene from outside of res://
data.body:
Hi,

It seems not possible to import sub-scenes from other projects. (I tried to replace `res://` by `c:/` without success)

It would be cool if it was possible, as it would allow having a 'custom database' of scenes that could be easily reused into several projects.

data.title: [minor request] the CheckButton misses an option to choose its default state from the editor
data.body:
Hi,

It would be cool if it was possible to choose the default on/off state of the CheckButton from the editor.

data.title: ignore and remove .fscache files. closes #1249
Fix mingw windows build error
remove .fscache from demos
data.body:
.fscache needs to be removed from 2 demos:
godot/demos/2d/polygon_path_finder_demo/.fscache
godot/demos/2d/hexamap/.fscache

and maybe add .fscache to .gitignore

data.title: MeshLibrary items preview are displayed upsidedown
data.body:
Hi, 

Godot 1.0stable official, win64.

preview images of the items displayed into a MeshLibrary pannel are displayed upsidedown.

data.title: Area2D::_clear_monitoring error after queue_free()
data.body:
After sync to github I got errors in console:

This function cause the area_2d error

```
func _on_Area2D_body_enter( body ):
    if ( body.is_in_group("bullet") ):
        body.queue_free()       <----------------------- this line cause error
        get_node("../..").queue_free()
```

data.title: Can't ask for autocomplete under mac
data.body:
Hi guys, i just try to use the latest version of godot from github as it solve some mapping problems under mac.

The problems is I can't ask autocomplete by pressing Ctrl + Space.

data.title: [Bug] Closing Godot with a Texture in the tree is loosing properties
data.body:
See this project: http://www.philiplb.de/misc/BGTest.zip
The initial settings of the node "background" where:
Anchors:
- left: begin
- right: end
- top: begin
- bottom: end
  Margins:
  0, 0, 0, 0

I save the project and closed Godot. On reopening, all anchors are back to begin and the margins are set to 400, 300, 400, 300 leaving the size to 0 pixel.

Current workaround is to set it in _ready:

```
var size = get_viewport_rect().size
var background = get_node("background")
background.set_custom_minimum_size(size)
background.set_anchor(MARGIN_LEFT, ANCHOR_BEGIN)
background.set_anchor(MARGIN_RIGHT, ANCHOR_END)
background.set_anchor(MARGIN_TOP, ANCHOR_BEGIN)
background.set_anchor(MARGIN_BOTTOM, ANCHOR_END)
background.set_margin(MARGIN_LEFT, 0)
background.set_margin(MARGIN_TOP, 0)
background.set_margin(MARGIN_RIGHT, 0)
background.set_margin(MARGIN_BOTTOM, 0)
```

data.title: Wrapped CellOp generation code in a function and added TileMap tile picking
data.body: Wrapped duplicated CellOp generation code in a function and added TileMap tile picking with Ctrl+LMB.

data.title: Changed the "Start the scene (F5)." tooltip to say "Play the project (F5)."
data.body:
"Start the scene" seems to be deceiving because if you're in a scene other than the main scene it will not run, but the main scene will be run instead, or rather the starting point of your project.

I changed the word "Start" to "Play" since it's consistent with the other two play options: "Play the edited scene. (F6)" and "Play custom scene. (Shift+Ctrl+F5)"

data.title: If main_scene is not set it will be set to the current scene...
data.body: If main_scene is not set it will be set to the current scene when running the project (or pressing F5)

data.title: added nvidia optimus enablement Issue #1120
data.body:
enables the dedicated gpu with nvidia optimus.
(windows only)

this only works for the exported game, not for the editor!

edit: even works for editor :D

I tried in normal mode and with admin rights..

Has someone else experienced the same and managed to fix that?

data.title: Tiles in gridmaps ignore material properties
data.body: Hey, there. It would appear that tiles placed by GridMap don't have the source objects' material properties. For example, all tiles in a GridMap tileset will always be double-sided, regardless of the material setting of the materials the tiles use.

data.title: Scenes Bleeding Over Into Each Other
data.body:
Hey, there. This doesn't seem to be a major bug, but it appears that scenes are bleeding over into each other at times.

![godotbleedingscenes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4733521/5783484/502c407e-9d78-11e4-94c4-4b469d3528f8.png)

In the attached screenshot, you can see that nowhere in my scene do I have a light or WorldEnvironment, and the default light is off, but the scene isn't dark. You can also see a tile from a GridMap that doesn't exist in the scene. These are both nodes missing from this scene, but present in the previous scene I opened in Godot.

While this may not be a big deal, I imagine it could cause crashing and problems (as I can fairly easily get Godot to crash just messing around with GridMaps; maybe this is part of the reason or something). Anyway, that's it.

P.S. That tile is most likely the cursor tile of the gridmap; it never disappears when you go from GridMap to another node.

data.title: GridMap Editor: shift + A S D buttons should rotate tile in reverse direction
data.body: Hey, there. So, the flipped Gridmap rotation controls (Shift+A, Shift+S, and Shift+D) are broken; they just rotate the tile in the same direction as the normal Gridmap rotation controls instead of the opposite direction, like they should.
